question: Who among the following has described India as “weak-strong state”?
explanation: Some Indian and Western scholars have tried to understand the nature of the Indian state in a rather objective and ideologically detached manner. Gunnar Myrdal, in his voluminous study entitled Asian Drama: An Inquiry into the Poverty of Nations, has called it a ‘soft state’, as it was unwilling and hesitant to take radical and drastic steps to destroy old religious attitudes, cultural patterns and social structures.
